programme.title: Newcastle United vs. Chelsea - English Premier League 2025/2026
programme.desc: Newcastle have won their last three Premier League home games against Chelsea, last winning more consecutively against them at St James’ Park between 1994 and 1998. Chelsea lost 2-0 at Newcastle in their last Premier League game against them but haven’t failed to score in consecutive league meetings with the Magpies since February 1933.

programme.title: Tottenham Hotspur vs. Liverpool - English Premier League 2025/2026
programme.desc: Tottenham have won just two of their last 25 Premier League games against Liverpool, picking up home wins in October 2017 and September 2023. Liverpool won both Premier League meetings with Spurs last season by 6-3 and 5-1 scorelines. Only the Reds themselves have scored 5+ goals in three consecutive games against an opponent in the competition, doing so against Norwich between September 2012 and December 2013.

programme.title: Aston Villa vs. Manchester United - English Premier League 2025/2026
programme.desc: Aston Villa have won just one of their last 26 Premier League home games against Manchester United, beating them 3-1 in November 2022 in Unai Emery’s first match in charge. Manchester United have won 41 Premier League games against Aston Villa, with 18 of those coming away from home. Only the Red Devils themselves have beaten an opponent more both overall and on the road.

programme.title: Valencia vs Mallorca - Spanish LaLiga 2025/26 - Week 17
programme.desc: Rayo Vallecano have won their last two LaLiga matches against Deportivo Alaves, keeping a clean sheet in both, and can claim three consecutive wins against the Vitoria-born side for the first time in their history in the competition. Alaves, with Abelardo Fernández as coach, won 5-1 against Rayo Vallecano in September 2018, the only time the Vitoria-born side has scored five goals in an away match in its entire top-flight history.

programme.title: Athletic Bilbao vs Espanyol - Spanish LaLiga 2025/26 - Week 17
programme.desc: Mallorca have won 75% of their home games against Levante in LaLiga, only against Rayo Vallecano do they have a higher win percentage than against the Granotas in the competition among all their rivals with at least five home games. Following their last win in January 2022, Levante can win back-to-back matches against Mallorca for the second time in their LaLiga history, having previously achieved this in their first two clashes in 2004 and 2005.

programme.title: Real Oviedo vs Celta Vigo - Spanish LaLiga 2025/26 - Week 17
programme.desc: Osasuna have lost two of their last three LaLiga matches against Celta de Vigo, the same number of defeats as in their previous nine top-flight matches. Following their 1-0 victory in February 2025, Celta de Vigo can achieve consecutive wins against Osasuna in LaLiga for the third time in the 21st century, and for the first time since their two victories in 2007 and 2012.

programme.title: Osasuna vs Deportivo Alaves - Spanish LaLiga 2025/26 - Week 17
programme.desc: Real Betis have picked up points in four of their last seven home games against Atletico de Madrid in LaLiga, having lost seven of their previous nine home games against the Rojiblancos in the competition. Atletico Madrid have never gone three consecutive away games without scoring against the Verdiblancos in the top flight.

programme.title: Real Madrid vs Sevilla - Spanish LaLiga 2025/26 - Week 17

programme.title: Jannik Sinner (ITA) vs Alexander Zverev (GER) -Mens Singles Final - Road Laver Arena - Australian O
programme.desc: The 2025 Australian Open men’s singles final sees defending champion and World No. 1 Jannik Sinner taking on World No. 2 Alexander Zverev. Sinner chases his third Grand Slam title after dominating Ben Shelton in the semifinals. Zverev, still in search of his first Grand Slam title, advanced after Novak Djokovic retired due to injury. A thrilling battle unfolds, with Sinner’s aggressive play clashing against Zverev’s powerful serves and groundstrokes.

programme.title: Finals - Arab Elite Tennis Championship - 2025
programme.desc: 5th Arab Tennis Elite Tournament – Manama, Bahrain concludes with the Singles Final as Mohammad Al Qutb (Jordan) meets Aziz Al Waqaa (Tunisia) on the hard courts of the Public Security Officers Club. A 24-player elite field from the Arab Tennis Federation circuit features ATP and ITF-ranked competitors, alongside a parallel U16 Arab Juniors event. Expect a high-tempo final shaped by big serving, aggressive returns and baseline control as the champion is crowned under the Manama lights.

programme.title: S. Bolelli (ITA) / A. Vavassori (ITA) vs H. Heliovaara (FIN) / H. Patten (GBR) - Mens Doubles Fin
programme.desc: In the 2025 Australian Open men’s doubles final, the Italian duo Simone Bolelli and Andrea Vavassori faces Harri Heliovaara and Henry Patten. Bolelli and Vavassori showcase their exceptional teamwork, while Heliovaara and Patten bring momentum from a hard-fought semifinal victory over Kevin Krawietz and Tim Putz. The match delivers a thrilling contest between two in-form teams battling for the prestigious title.

programme.title: K. Siniakova (CZE) / T. Townsend (USA) vs S. Hsieh (TPE) / J. Ostapenko (LAT) -Womens Doubles Fina
programme.desc: The 2025 Australian Open women’s doubles final features top seeds Kateřina Siniaková and Taylor Townsend against third seeds Hsieh Su-wei and Jeļena Ostapenko. Siniaková and Townsend, fresh off their Wimbledon triumph, aim for another Grand Slam title. Hsieh and Ostapenko, despite being a relatively new pairing, have impressed with their strong chemistry, including a hard-fought semifinal win over Gabriela Dabrowski and Erin Routliffe. A thrilling battle between two exceptional teams unfolds.

programme.title: Jannik SINNER (ITA) vs Carlos ALCARAZ (ESP) - Mens Singles - Finals - Philippe-Chatrier Court - R
programme.desc: Defending champion Carlos Alcaraz faces World No. 1 Jannik Sinner in a highly anticipated final. Alcaraz aims to retain his title, while Sinner seeks his first Roland-Garros crown. Both players have showcased exceptional form throughout the tournament, setting the stage for a thrilling championship match.

programme.title: AO Originals - Ambition
programme.desc: AMBITION is the story of tennis’ fearless new breed rewriting the rules on the sport’s biggest stage - with Alcaraz, Sinner, Gauff, Swiatek and a wave of hungry young challengers reshaping the game with raw talent and audacious self-belief

programme.title: Aryna SABALENKA vs Coco GAUFF (USA) - Womens Singles - Finals - Philippe-Chatrier Court - Roland G
programme.desc: World No. 1 Aryna Sabalenka takes on World No. 2 Coco Gauff in a blockbuster Roland-Garros final. With their head-to-head tied at 5–5, and both players chasing their first Roland-Garros crown, this rivalry reaches a new peak on the Paris clay. A Grand Slam classic in the making.

programme.title: Marcel GRANOLLERS (ESP) / Horacio ZEBALLOS (ARG) vs Joe SALISBURY (GBR)/Neal SKUPSKI (GBR) - Mens
programme.desc: Fifth seeds Marcel Granollers and Horacio Zeballos face eighth seeds Joe Salisbury and Neal Skupski in a high-stakes final. Granollers and Zeballos, seeking their first Grand Slam title together after three previous final appearances, take on the British duo, who aim to become the first all-British team to win the Roland-Garros mens doubles since 1936. A compelling clash of experience and ambition on the Paris clay.

programme.title: Anna DANILINA (KAZ) Aleksandra KRUNIC (SRB) vs Sara ERRANI (ITA) Jasmine PAOLINI (ITA) - Womens Dou
programme.desc: Second seeds Sara Errani and Jasmine Paolini take on Anna Danilina and Aleksandra Krunić in the womens doubles final. Errani and Paolini, finalists for the second consecutive year, aim to secure their first Roland-Garros title as a team against the unseeded duo of Danilina and Krunić

programme.title: AO Originals - Ambition
programme.desc: AMBITION is the story of tennis’ fearless new breed rewriting the rules on the sport’s biggest stage - with Alcaraz, Sinner, Gauff, Swiatek and a wave of hungry young challengers reshaping the game with raw talent and audacious self-belief

programme.title: Jannik Sinner (ITA) vs Carlos Alcaraz (ESP) - Gentlemen’s Singles Final - Centre Court - Wimbledon 2
programme.desc: Top seed Jannik Sinner takes on defending champion Carlos Alcaraz in a blockbuster Wimbledon final. This is their fifth career meeting, with Alcaraz leading the head-to-head 3–1. Sinner is chasing his first Wimbledon crown, while Alcaraz aims for a historic third straight title. A generational battle on Centre Court.

programme.title: Fast Zone 2025 Ep.36
programme.desc: Covering everything from prototypes to endurance racing, karting to airplanes and even some real oddities… With both tradition and a fresh take on motorsport, Fast/Zone is the ultimate resource for everything that is fast and fascinating!

programme.title: Amanda Anisimova (USA) vs Iga Swiatek (POL) - Ladies’ Singles Final - Centre Court - Wimbledon 2025
programme.desc: A first-time Wimbledon champion will be crowned as Iga Świątek faces Amanda Anisimova. Świątek, a five-time Grand Slam winner, reaches her first final at SW19. Anisimova, playing her maiden major final, stunned world No. 1 Sabalenka in the semis. This is their first-ever meeting. Experience vs momentum — who will triumph on Centre Court?

programme.title: Rinky Hijikata (AUS)/David Pel (NED) vs Julian Cash (GBR)/Lloyd Glasspool (GBR) - Gentlemens Doubl
programme.desc: British duo Lloyd Glasspool and Julian Cash contest their first Grand Slam final against Australia’s Rinky Hijikata and David Pel. The unseeded pair stunned the top seeds in the semi-finals. This is the first-ever meeting between the teams, with Glasspool and Cash bidding to become the first all-British Wimbledon men’s doubles champions since 1936.

programme.title: Finals - Arab Elite Tennis Championship - 2025
programme.desc: 5th Arab Tennis Elite Tournament – Manama, Bahrain concludes with the Singles Final as Mohammad Al Qutb (Jordan) meets Aziz Al Waqaa (Tunisia) on the hard courts of the Public Security Officers Club. A 24-player elite field from the Arab Tennis Federation circuit features ATP and ITF-ranked competitors, alongside a parallel U16 Arab Juniors event. Expect a high-tempo final shaped by big serving, aggressive returns and baseline control as the champion is crowned under the Manama lights.

programme.title: Jannik Sinner vs Carlos Alcaraz - Men’s Singles Final - Arthur Ashe Court - Tennis US Open 2025
programme.desc: Two young giants renew one of tennis’s fiercest rivalries. Alcaraz, already a two-time Grand Slam champion and former US Open winner, leads their head-to-head by a slim margin. Sinner, the 2024 Australian Open champion, seeks to level the balance. A clash of power, speed, and mental edge with the title in New York on the line.

programme.title: Aryna Sabalenka vs Amanda Anisimova - Women’s Singles Final - Arthur Ashe Court - Tennis US Open 202
programme.desc: World No. 1 and defending champion Aryna Sabalenka returns to Arthur Ashe Stadium aiming for her fourth Grand Slam crown and successive US Open titles. Across the net, Amanda Anisimova reaches her first New York final after stunning Iga Świątek and Naomi Osaka. The American leads their rivalry 6–3, adding intrigue to a high-stakes clash. Victory would place the winner among the defining stories of the 125th US Open.

programme.title: Holger RUNE (DEN) vs Jack DRAPER (GBR) - Final BNP Paribas Open - presentado por HSBC 2025 - TENNIS
programme.desc: Holger Rune (DEN) meets Jack Draper (GBR) in the 2025 BNP Paribas Open final, the first ATP Masters 1000 title match between two players born in the 2000s. Rune defeated Daniil Medvedev in the semis with sharp tactics, while Draper edged past Carlos Alcaraz, displaying power and resilience. Rune leads their head-to-head 1-0, having won their 2024 Cincinnati clash in straight sets.

programme.title: Jakub Mensik (CZE) vs Novak Djokovic (SRB) - Final - Miami Open 2025 - presented by Itaú - ATP 1000
programme.desc: 19-year-old Mensik, the Czech phenom, blasts into his first Masters final—taking down Top 10 giants with missile serves and fearless power. One win from history as youngest Miami champ ever.Across the net: Djokovic. The old lion prowls for his 7th Miami throne—still devouring dreamers.Tonight, fire meets fortress. The future charges at forever.

DR Congo vs Benin - African Cup of Nations - Morocco 2025
programme.desc: This will be the first ever AFCON encounter between DR Congo and Benin. Their only previous meeting came in a couple of FIFA World Cup qualifiers in 2021, during which DR Congo remained unbeaten. This is DR Congo’s 21st appearance at the CAF Africa Cup of Nations. They have won the tournament on two occasions: in 1968 as Congo-Kinshasa and in 1974 as Zaire.

programme.title: Senegal vs Botswana - African Cup of Nations - Morocco 2025
programme.desc: This will be the first ever AFCON encounter between Senegal and Botswana. Their only previous meeting came in a couple of AFCON qualifiers in 2014 – Senegal won both matches. Senegal are making their 18th appearance at the CAF Africa Cup of Nations, whilst it’s also the first time they have qualified for six consecutive AFCON tournaments. They have one title to their name, beating Egypt on penalties to win the 2022 tournament.

programme.title: Nigeria vs Tanzania - African Cup of Nations - Morocco 2025
programme.desc: This will be the second AFCON encounter between Nigeria and Tanzania. Their only previous meeting was 45 years ago, in 1980 – Nigeria won 3-1 before going on to lift their first ever AFCON title. Nigeria are making their 21st appearance at the CAF Africa Cup of Nations. They have won the tournament on three occasions and reached the semi-finals in 15 of their last 18 AFCON participations.

programme.title: Tunisia vs Uganda - African Cup of Nations - Morocco 2025
programme.desc: This will be the third encounter between Tunisia and Uganda at AFCON, but also their first meeting in the tournament for 47 years. Tunisia won both of their previous matches, scoring six goals and conceding only one. This is Tunisia’s 22nd participation in the CAF Africa Cup of Nations, and their 17th in a row, the latter being a record in the history of the tournament. Their only AFCON title dates back to 2004, as hosts; since then, they’ve progressed past the quarter-finals only once, in 2019, losing in the third-place match.

Burkina faso vs Equatorial Guinea - African Cup of Nations - Morocco 2025
programme.desc: This will be the second AFCON encounter between Burkina Faso and Equatorial Guinea. Their only previous meeting was in the 2015 group stages – it ended goalless. In fact, both of their last two encounters haven’t produced a single goal: the 2015 AFCON match and a friendly in 2023. This is Burkina Faso’s 14th appearance in the CAF Africa Cup of Nations. Their best performance to date was in 2013 when they reached the final for the first and so far only time in the country’s history – they lost 1-0 against Nigeria, in South Africa.

programme.title: Algeria vs Sudan - African Cup of Nations - Morocco 2025
programme.desc: This will be the first ever AFCON encounter between Algeria and Sudan. Sudan are unbeaten in their last two games against Algeria in all competitions, winning on penalties in the quarter finals of the African Nations Championship in August and a 0-0 draw in the FIFA Arab Cup earlier this month. Algeria are making their 21st appearance at the CAF Africa Cup of Nations. They will be attempting to win the trophy for the third time, after 1990 and 2019 – both previous victories were won on North African soil: at home in 1990 and in Egypt in 2019.

programme.title: Cote dIvoire vs Mozambique - African Cup of Nations - Morocco 2025
programme.desc: This will be the third AFCON encounter between Côte d’Ivoire and Mozambique. The two previous meetings produced Ivorian victories, both in the group stages: 1986 and 1996. Côte d’Ivoire are taking part in their 26th CAF Africa Cup of Nations; only Egypt have made more appearances in the continent’s premier competition. They will be attempting to win the trophy for the fourth time, after 1992, 2015 and 2024.

programme.title: Cameroon vs Gabon - African Cup of Nations - Morocco 2025
programme.desc: This will be the third AFCON encounter between Cameroon and Gabon. The two previous meetings produced only one goal, with Gabon winning 1-0 in 2010 before a goalless draw in 2017. Only against Guinea have Cameroon played more matches at AFCON without ending up on the winning side. The last time Cameroon lost their opening match at an AFCON was in 2010 – against Gabon.

This is Mali’s 14th participation in the CAF Africa Cup of Nations, including their 10th in a row; no side has played as many games as Mali at AFCON without ever winning the trophy. programme.title: Morocco vs UAE - Semi-Finals - Fifa Arab cup 2025
programme.desc: The 2025 FIFA Arab Cup takes place in Qatar from 1st to 18th December 2025.Every game will be live on beIN.This is the third time that Qatar will host the FIFA Arab Cup following the 1998 and 2021 editions. Algeria are the defending champions.

programme.title: KSA vs Jordan - Semi-Finals - Fifa Arab cup 2025
programme.desc: The 2025 FIFA Arab Cup takes place in Qatar from 1st to 18th December 2025.Every game will be live on beIN.This is the third time that Qatar will host the FIFA Arab Cup following the 1998 and 2021 editions. Algeria are the defending champions.

programme.title: Jordan vs Morocco - Final - Fifa Arab cup 2025
programme.desc: Jordan and Morocco go head-to-head for the right to be crowned FIFA Arab Cup 2025 champions.This is Jordan’s second successive major final after finishing runners up in the AFC Asian Cup Final 2024.FIFA World Cup 2022 semi-finalists, Morocco, will start as favourites. Both nations have qualified for the FIFA World Cup 2026.The match is live from a sold-out Lusail Stadium, Doha, Qatar.
